intro: Carpodinus oxyanthoides, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs. The flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, and the plant produces small, dry fruits that contain numerous seeds.
